Package tests.sic.sST.poisson

tests.sic.sST.poisson package: implements exact and/or heuristic algorithms for the global optimization of long-run expected average costs of a single-echelon inventory control system operating a periodic review control policy (s,S,T) facing Poisson distributed demands in a continuous time cost-accounting setting.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Poisson2
    auxiliary class to make Poisson computations from the Colt library behave the same as in MATLAB, at least for the purposes needed in this package.
    sSTCpoisson
    function implements the continuous-time long-run expected cost of a periodic review, single echelon inventory control system facing exogenous demands generated in a period of length T, from a Poisson process with parameter λ.
    sSTCpoissonBoxed
    the class extends the sSTCpoisson class with the functionality that it projects any argument for evaluation into the feasible region of the class.
    sSTCpoissonFixedTOpt
    class implements an optimizer over the first two variables of the (s,S,T) policy, namely the reorder point s and the order-up-to S variables, for given (fixed) review period T.
    sSTCpoissonFixedTOpterResult
    auxiliary class that is essentially just an immutable struct, holding 5 double values.
    sSTCpoissonFixedTOptTask
    auxiliary class encapsulating the notion of optimizing an sSTCpoisson function, with a fixed review period T.
    sSTCpoissonHeurOpt
    class computes an approximate solution to the (s,S,T) policy optimization under Poisson demands, by computing the optimal (r,nQ,T) policy parameters r*,Q*, and T* -which is usually done much faster- and then computing the optimal (s(t),S(t)) parameters for t close to T* and picking the best set of parameters.
    sSTCpoissonOpt
    class implements an optimizer over ALL three variables of the (s,S,T) policy, namely the reorder point s, the order-up-to point S and the review period T.
    TestPoisson  

Package tests.sic.sST.poisson Description

tests.sic.sST.poisson package: implements exact and/or heuristic algorithms for the global optimization of long-run expected average costs of a single-echelon inventory control system operating a periodic review control policy (s,S,T) facing Poisson distributed demands in a continuous time cost-accounting setting.

Package Specification

The formulae for the average cost of such a system are taken from the classic IE textbook of Hadley and Whitin, "Analysis of Inventory Systems", 1963.
